this photograph is beautiful. the sweet and innocent look of these boys is wonderful.

comment.author: 7621733@N02
comment._content: Scenes like this are so familiar from films - where they're pretending - this is the real deal! Wonderful!

comment.author: 37232142@N06
comment._content:
put this photo in black and white and you will have the classical romantic look of the 1940s,,,,,while in color it reveals how the clothes of those boys were poor, unclean and not in good order,,,,,,,
thank you for this realistic view ,,,,,it is sort of curing for my obsession with black and white photos!

comment.author: 41106620@N04
comment._content: Hi, we are a group dedicated to photos of typo/graphic posters and it would be a pleasure to have this photo in our showcase: typo/graphic posters

comment.author: 49969718@N04
comment._content: I agree with you, Qasem-Amin.  The color in this picture makes all the difference, as it does it many pictures.  Is the smaller child old enough to be in school?

comment.author: 53412787@N05
comment._content:
I like this photo.. Especially the bright colors on the poster..
I like how most of the picture has a khaki feel to it.

comment.author: 34918130@N07
comment._content: When you analyze the buttonless shirt, you may also look closer.    The Sweet Little Boys have soiled clothes.    Back in those days the Mom and Dad suffered to provide.   They had to wash clothes by hand or an old gas engine Machine.   Many had to haul their water.    I could write a book on their hardships.   Great Photo to seeing what it was like way back then.   Sweet Little Boys.
